page.title: 13Unemployment
page.content: Unemployment In the late 19th century Coatbridge became known as the "Iron Burgh" because of the large number of iron works and related industries. Since then heavy industries have rapidly declined and practically disappeared.The unemployment rate is one of the highest in the U.K. To help the unemployed Strathclyde Regonal Council aided by the European Social Fund have set up an employment grants scheme.The aim is to encourage businesses to employ more people aged between 18 and 24. In Whifflet primary school there is an office of the Y.T.S. which is the Youth Training Scheme which is also trying to help the young unemployed.
